description: 'Funeral Parade of Roses' (1969) was a major influence on Stanley Kubrick's 'Clockwork Orange' (1971)

title: Red Carpet Premiere of LUCKY
brief_description: Lexington is proud to host a red carpet premiere of Harry Dean Stanton's newest film (and 2nd ever starring role!), LUCKY, in anticipation of its New York and Los Angeles release the following day.
description:
Opening Night of Harry Dean Stanton Fest 7!

Lexington is proud to host a red carpet premiere of Harry Dean Stanton's newest film (and 2nd ever starring role!), LUCKY, in anticipation of its New York and Los Angeles release the following day. Director John Carroll Lynch and writer Drago Sumonja will engage in a Q&A following the film.

The premiere after-party will be held on the second floor of the Bar Complex. Mingle with the filmmakers, enjoy drinks, and dance to tunes provided by Lee Bryant in one of Lexington's most beautiful spaces.

Proceeds from this event will be split evenly between Friends of the Kentucky Theatre and future programming for Harry Dean Stanton Fest.

Ticket price includes refreshments. Tickets can be purchased at: https://www.showclix.com/event/lucky-premiere-with-john-carroll-lynch-qa

Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2KLLkj84GAo

Full festival information: http://www.harrydeanstantonfest.org/

'Everything Harry Dean Stanton has done in his career, and his life, has brought him to his moment of triumph in Lucky, an unassumingly wonderful little film about nothing in particular and everything that's important.' -Variety

John Carroll Lynch is an actor/director who first gained notoriety for his role as Norm Gunderson in FARGO. He is known for his television work on the ABC sitcom The Drew Carey Show as the title character's brother, Steve Carey, as well as on American Horror Story: Freak Show and American Horror Story: Cult as Twisty the Clown. His films include GRAN TURINO, SHUTTER ISLAND, ZODIAC, THE GOOD GIRL, and WAKING THE DEAD. LUCKY is his directorial debut.

Drago Sumonja is an actor/writer/director who previously worked with Harry Dean Stanton on the acclaimed (and much recommended!) documentary CHAR-AC-TER, which he directed.

Endless thanks to our event sponsors: Equus/Standardbred Station, Inc., Kentucky For Kentucky, The Green Lantern Bar, CD Central, The Bar Complex, and 21c Museum Hotel Lexington

title: Higher

description: You know this is the best place to dance to disco in the country right? We will turn the lights off, turn the volume up, and forget the outside world and its troubles. We do hope that youâ€™ll join us.

title: The Straight Story Outdoor Screening and Harry Dean Mural Debut
brief_description: When we programmed this year's Harry Dean Stanton Fest, the last thing we wanted to imagine was that this year's event might be a memorial. But now that it is, we are so grateful that we chose to close it with The Straight Story.
description:
When we programmed this year's Harry Dean Stanton Fest, the last thing we wanted to imagine was that this year's event might be a memorial. But now that it is, we are so grateful that we chose to close it with The Straight Story.

The last three minutes of screen time are all Harry's, and they are some of the most moving moments of his entire career. David Lynch has heralded this as his favorite collaboration with Harry, and we tend to agree. And when the camera tilts up to the stars at the end of the movie...we'll be sitting under them.

The evening will kick off at 7 pm with the debut of Lexington's newest mural--Harry's beautiful face on the side of the Kentucky Fun Mall as designed and produced by Graham Allen and Geoff Murphy of SQUAREPEGS Design. There will be a food truck (Minton's at 760!) and beer booth (Rock House Brewing!) and the movie will begin at dusk. Please join us for this outdoor event as we commemorate an unparalleled career and a fellow Kentuckian's life well lived.

Bryan Avenue will be closed for this event. Please bring lawn chairs or other seating implements.

Many thanks to our friends at Kentucky For Kentucky for making this free event possible. Additional thanks to our other sponsors: Equus/Standardbred Station, Inc., 21c Museum Hotel Lexington, The Green Lantern Bar, CD Central, and The Bar Complex.

For full information on other Harry Dean Stanton Fest events, please visit: www.harrydeanstantonfest.org

title: Home Movie Day With the Kentucky Amateur Film Archives
brief_description: The Kentucky Amateur Film Archives (KAFA) presents Home Movie Day at 21c Museum Hotel Lexington)
description:
The Kentucky Amateur Film Archives (KAFA) presents Home Movie Day at 21c Museum Hotel Lexington. Bring your home movies on 16mm, 8mm, Super-8, and video to learn about preservation and share them with others.

The program will feature a selection of films from the KAFA collection, including the premiere of a selection of 8mm home movies from Hungary with a collaborative score by Scott Whiddon, John Ferguson (Desperate Spirits Records), and Wyatt Nicholson (Athens, GA).

title: WRFL presents: Ballister
brief_description: Outside the Spotlight featuring Ballister:Dave Rempis- alto/tenor/baritone saxophone, Fred Lonberg Holm- cello, Paal Nilssen Love- percussion Free Admission
description:
Outside the Spotlight featuring Ballister

Dave Rempis- alto/tenor/baritone saxophone

Fred Lonberg Holm- cello

Paal Nilssen Love- percussion

'Ballister might start the question: what do we do with all this energy? Rage, yes; but there is more... the trio burns, but not for the sake of combustion. In between the uproar is the meat, the viscera, and the heart of sound.This trio finds beauty in the maelstrom.' -New York City Jazz Record

Ballister will be performing at the Niles Gallery, located inside the lobby of the Lucille Little Fine Arts Library on October 2nd at 7pm. Admission is free.

https://www.daverempis.com/ballister-1/

title: 193 Sound+WRFL Present Rafael Toral/Ryan Jewell Duo
brief_description: Rafael Toral is a Lisbon based electronic musician who has been actively performing for guitar and customized electronic instruments since the early 90's. Ryan Jewell is an experimental percussionist and composer from Columbus, Ohio
description:
Institute 193 and WRFL 88.1 FM Radio Free Lexington are pleased to present an ongoing series of experimental music performances, curated and organized by Robert Beatty

Rafael Toral is a Lisbon based electronic musician who has been actively performing for guitar and customized electronic instruments since the early 90's. Some of his numerous collaborators include Sonic Youth, Alvin Lucier, Tatsuya Nakatani, and Christian Marclay.

Ryan Jewell is an experimental percussionist and composer from Columbus, Ohio who displays an extremely diverse range of techniques and appraoches. Aside from playing solo he has been a member of the bands Psychedelic Horseshit and Mosses and has recently served as percussionist for Weyes Blood, Ryley Walker, Circuit Des Yeux, and Cian Nugent.

title: Howard Finster: Prophecy on Plywood
brief_description: Please join us for the opening reception of Howard Finster: Prophecy on plywood
description:
Please join us for the opening reception of Howard Finster: Prophecy on plywood.

Howard Finster produced over 46,000 works over the course of his lifetime,but his cutouts make up the bulk of his output. Cheap and reasonably weather resistant, plywood offered a flat surface that could endure the seasons, especially when covered in oil-based tractor enamel. When asked about the use of this particular paint, Finster declared it 'the best paint in the world.' He had painted his tractor with it and after years of heat and humidity, it'still look good.'

Howard Finster's artistic career developed alongside his activities as a preacher and work as a builder and handyman. His first combinations of words and images, called 'chalk work', came in the form of blackboard diagrams that he made while teaching Sunday school. Essential to Finster's visual language is his intermixing of biblical references and American pop culture. Henry Ford,Albert Einstein, Elvis Presley and other iconic celebrities are represented for their accomplishments that are 'biblical' in scale, appearing with archangels, dinosaurs, Siamese Twins, and Coca-Cola bottles. Finster saw the existence of these men and objects as the fulfillment of biblical prophecy.

This exhibition was made possible in part thanks to a grant from Visit LEX.

title: Y'Art Sale
brief_description: The UK Art Museum in collaboration with Robbie Morgan present Yâ€™ART SALE, a city-wide outdoor event
description:
The UK Art Museum in collaboration with Robbie Morgan present Yâ€™ART SALE, a city-wide outdoor event on Saturday, September 23, from 8am â€“ 2 pm, rain or shine. Participants include notable artists, educators, and patrons around Lexington.

Featuring traditional and unusual yard sale items: furniture, collectibles, appliances, bric-a-brac, electronics, kid's items, fashions, etc., alongside original works of art, art supplies, etc.

We love the idea of art enthusiasts and bargain hunters driving around town, engaging with creative individuals and finding things they just canâ€™t live without.

title: Horse's Mouth Storytelling Night: 'Anniversary!'
brief_description: This month's theme is 'Anniversary.' Six storytellers will tell true, live stories about anniversaries. . . the good, the bad, and the ugly.
description: This month's theme is 'Anniversary.' Six storytellers will tell true, live stories about anniversaries. . . the good, the bad, and the ugly.
